summary:
=== Purchase Information === Product Title: The 4400: Season 4 Review Date: 2008/05/18 Store: Joel Gretsch (Actor), Jacqueline McKenzie (Actor), Allison Liddi (Director), Colin Bucksey (Director) & 1 more Rated: NR Format: DVD Categories: Movies & TV, Paramount Home Entertainment, Boxed Sets Product Description: ['Product Description', "When 4400 alien abductees return to earth just as mysteriously as they vanished, the Department of Homeland Security demands answers. But even more pressing than the concerns of the government are the experiences of the victims as they readjust to life on earth. Upon their return, these formerly missing persons lose all memory of what happened to them. THE 4400 continues with this collection of all 13 episodes of the series' fourth season. Star Joel Gretsch, Mahershalalhashbaz Ali, Conchita Campbell, Jacqueline McKenszie, Patrick Flueger, Megalyn Echikumwoke Special Features: Full Frame - 1.33 Audio: 5.1 Surround Dolby Digital Stereo English Runtime: 561 minutes Year of Release: 2006.", 'Amazon.com', "There's nothing like a psych-out to shake things up. In", 'The 4400', "'s fourth season opener, everyone has taken the medicine Jordan Collier (Billy Campbell) distributed in year three, and all's right with the world. Then he wakes up from his dream. In truth, promicin helps some and harms others. Soon, Shawn (Patrick Flueger) emerges from his coma and Isabelle (Megalyn Echikunwoke), who tried to kill him, escapes from prison. As for NTAC, agents Tom (Joel Gretsch) still mourns the missing Alana, while Diana (Jacqueline McKenzie) returns to work when she finds out her sister, April (Natasha Gregson Wagner), has taken the shot. As the season continues, promicin-related strangeness accelerates, like the outcast (Cameron Bright) who becomes a messiah--and insists his followers only listen to TV on the radio--or the librarian (Constance Towers) who can astral project. An attractive new NTAC supervisor, Meghan Doyle (Jenni Baird), joins Tom and Diana to monitor the positives and those they affect, including Tom's son, Kyle (Chad Faust), who helps Collier establish Seattle's Promise City, an all-positive community. As ever, shades of grey dominate, and anyone can change at any time. Even an NTAC agent can become one of the Marked.", 'The fourth year ends with a viral outbreak, followed by the death of a key character. For the most part, though, the conclusion holds out hope for relations between the positives and the rest of the population--if they can stop the Marked in time. Because the USA Network chose not to renew the show, some questions may never be answered. Fortunately,', 'The 4400', 'went out with both humor and heart. Extra features include deleted scenes, featurettes, a blooper reel, and commentary from creator Scott Peters on "Till We Have Built Jerusalem" and the director\'s cut of finalé "The Great Leap Forward."', '--Kathleen C. Fennessy'] Average Rating: 4.5 Product Details: {'Genre': 'Science Fiction & Fantasy', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, AC-3, Box set, Color, Dolby, Subtitled, NTSC', 'Contributor': 'Joel Gretsch, Mahershalalhashbaz Ali, Craig Ross Jr., Jeffrey Combs, Nick Copus, Patrick Flueger, Chad Faust, Megalyn Echikunwoke, Conchita Campbell, Allison Liddi, Leslie Libman, Bill Campbell, Colin Bucksey, Penny Johnson, Morgan Beggs, Scott Peters, Ernest R. Dickerson, Laura Allen, Jacqueline McKenzie, Jenni BairdJoel Gretsch, Mahershalalhashbaz Ali, Craig Ross Jr., Jeffrey Combs, Nick Copus, Patrick Flueger, Chad Faust, Megalyn Echikunwoke, Conchita Campbell, Allison Liddi, Leslie Libman, Bill Campbell, Colin Bucksey, Penny Johnson, Morgan Beggs, Scott Peters, Ernest R. Dicker… See more', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1), Spanish (Dolby Digital 2.0 Mono), Unqualified (DTS ES 6.1), English (Dolby Digital 2.0 Surround)', 'Number Of Discs': '4', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 8 Ounces', 'Item model number': '120999098', 'Director': 'Allison Liddi, Colin Bucksey, Craig Ross Jr., Ernest R. Dickerson, Leslie Libman', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, AC-3, Box set, Color, Dolby, Subtitled, NTSC', 'Run time': '9 hours and 21 minutes', 'Release date': 'May 6, 2008', 'Actors': 'Joel Gretsch, Jacqueline McKenzie, Patrick Flueger, Chad Faust, Conchita Campbell', 'Subtitles': 'English, Portuguese, Spanish', 'Studio': 'Paramount', 'Number of discs': '4'} Review Text: Nice DVD set, your standard box set. No complaints there. USA sucks for cutting the series short though, if you missed the last season and need to play catch up it's worth it, just dont expect a whole lot of much needed closure. Review Title: Great show, Crappy way to end it....or lack of an ending Rating: 4.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: Crank / Crank 2 Review Date: 2011/04/13 Store: Jason Statham (Actor), Amy Smart (Actor), Mark Neveldine (Director), Brian Taylor (Director) & 1 more Rated: NR Format: Blu-ray Categories: Movies & TV, Featured Categories, Blu-ray, Action & Adventure Average Rating: 4.1 Product Details: {'Aspect Ratio': '1.78:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 6.4 Ounces', 'Item model number': '29270', 'Director': 'Mark Neveldine, Brian Taylor', 'Media Format': 'Blu-ray, Multiple Formats, NTSC', 'Release date': 'November 23, 2010', 'Actors': 'Jason Statham, Amy Smart, Efren Ramirez, Jose Pablo Cantillo, Jay Xcala', 'Studio': 'Lions Gate', 'Number of discs': '2'} Review Text: You can't beat this price for two blu ray movies. The fact that it is part 1 & part 2 of crank makes it great. Sometimes you get value packs and it's one movie you want and one movie from 1976 only your dad has watched and he didn't much care for it. I'd say buy this, it's worth it. I'm not going to explain the plot for you, but the movies are good. I just wanted to comment that the value you get is worth the cost and the quality of the packaging and the disks are first rate. Nothing cheap about this disk set, simple yes, but well manufactured. Review Title: Good movie, Even better value pack. Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: Sleeping Beauty (Two-Disc Platinum Edition Blu-ray/DVD Combo + BD Live) [Blu-ray] Review Date: 2012/01/26 Store: Mary Costa (Actor), Eleanor Audley (Actor), Clyde Geronimi (Director) & 0 more Rated: G Format: Blu-ray Categories: Movies & TV, Blu-ray, Movies Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Genre': 'Kids & Family, Special Interests, Action & Adventure', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Multiple Formats', 'Contributor': 'Winston Hibler, Verna Felton, Dal McKennon, Milt Banta, Joe Rinaldi, Marvin Miller, Bill Peet, Clyde Geronimi, Bill Amsbery, Pinto Colvig, Barbara Luddy, Barbara Jo Allen, Mary Costa, Taylor Holmes, Ted Sears, Candy Candido, Charles Perrault, Erdman Penner, Eleanor Audley, Bill Shirley, Bill ThompsonWinston Hibler, Verna Felton, Dal McKennon, Milt Banta, Joe Rinaldi, Marvin Miller, Bill Peet, Clyde Geronimi, Bill Amsbery, Pinto Colvig, Barbara Luddy, Barbara Jo Allen, Mary Costa, Taylor Holmes, Ted Sears, Candy Candido, Charles Perrault, Erdman Penner, Eleanor Audle… See more', 'Language': 'English', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 15 minutes'} Review Text: First of all let me state the truth, I haven't watched this movie in a long time and when I did ( some 20 years ago) I recalled it being dull and flat in it's imagery. Not the same, this remastered bluray is amazing. The colors are striking and its amazing how everything "pops". The story is great too, It's a classic, if you are a boy or a girl it doesn't matter, each can relate. This is a set I would highly recommend, and I would suggest buying it new and joining the Disney Movie rewards program, if you are going to buy the movies you might as well join the free points program, registering your movies gives you free streaming options ( on certain disks) an affordable disc replacement program and a few other minor benefits, its free so might as well. Oi, I sound like I'm being paid to advertise it, I'm not, I'm just a mom and I try to get the best deals possible and share it. Review Title: Excellent, remastered, bright and lovely. Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: Sid the Science Kid: Sid - Sid's Sing Along Review Date: 2012/01/27 Store: Sid (Actor), The Jim Henson Company (Director) Rated: Unrated Format: DVD Categories: Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Kids & Family Product Description: ['Sid the Science Kid is an animated television series using comedy to promote exploration, discovery and science among preschoolers. The characters pose questions and investigate objects and events that can be directly observed and explored.'] Average Rating: 4.7 Product Details: {'Genre': 'Kids & Family', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Animated, Color, NTSC', 'Contributor': 'The Jim Henson Company, Sid', 'Language': 'English', 'Number Of Discs': '1', 'MPAA rating': 'Unrated (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.6 x 5.4 x 7.5 inches; 2.4 Ounces', 'Item model number': '15764317', 'Director': 'The Jim Henson Company', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Animated, Color, NTSC', 'Run time': '1 hour', 'Release date': 'September 15, 2017', 'Actors': 'Sid', 'Studio': 'NCircle Entertainment', 'Number of discs': '1'} Review Text: This is a cute DVD, my kid likes it and I am not annoyed with it in the least. My kid loves music and sing a longs, although you should know there are no follow the bouncing ball sing along here. The sing along, is more like a pageant that the kids throw on a day off school where they sing their favorite songs from school.

The only thing is there seems to be an exceptional amount of trailers or commercials for other cartoons on it. The longest I have ever experienced in any movie. Review Title: It's cute ( a lot of trailers though) Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2012/12/13 Average Rating: 4.7 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'frightening scenes', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Bradley Buecker', 'Alfonso Gomez-Rejon', 'Michael Uppendahl', 'Loni Peristere', 'John J. Gray', 'Jennifer Lynch', 'Gwyneth Horder-Payton', 'Michael Goi', 'Ryan Murphy', 'Michael Lehmann'], 'Starring': ['Lily Rabe', 'Evan Peters', 'Sarah Paulson'], 'Studio': ['FX']} Review Text: Season two of the American Horror story anthology is shaping up to be a "wtf" thrill ride. Well, not an edge of your seat roller coaster ride where you pee your pants or barf in your own face, but more like a nervous passenger in the car while your recently immigrated relative drives on 405 with their new license. You might be thinking, well...that doesn't sound pleasant, but to people like me who like this crap, it is very enjoyable. It is nice for once to not know what the hell is going on in advance, what to expect from the characters, to rely on the same song sung by a different singer over and over and over again in television and movies gets old quick. It's usually always the same damn drivel recycled, and thankfully that is not the case with this show.

Having a show where boy meets girl is not the center of the plot is nice as well. I can't recall a series where there is more than one "bad guy" and added to that developed characters you get sympathy for, save for maybe Dexter. Also a new thing is having different "bad guy" types/categories. For example you'll never see a show with zombies AND Psycho serial killers, especially not with Nazi evil scientists and slutty nuns. I mean call me crazy but even Dexter has drawn it's line of bridges it won't cross. This show doesn't care, it walks in the room and lays it's gigantic balls on the table and say's "See this, I'm doing it, because **** You, that's why"

I liked season one, it was completely different from this one, and that is something I also really like a lot. The anthological nature of the series is pretty cool, because honestly with that much chaos you can't keep it up without the show turning to poo. Also, The opening credits nerps me out, I feel like I am watching old scare tv from the early 90's late 80's, in the dark as a fragile minded preteen. Remember Elvira? Freakshow? Tales from the crypt? We've needed something new that follows those footsteps, the bastard child of the creepshow. Watch a few episodes, you might really like it. Review Title: This show is great. We've needed a good "horror" show on TV for awhile now. Rating: 5.0 --------------------------------------------------

Dickerson, Leslie Libman', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, AC-3, Box set, Color, Dolby, Subtitled, NTSC', 'Run time': '9 hours and 21 minutes', 'Release date': 'May 6, 2008', 'Actors': 'Joel Gretsch, Jacqueline McKenzie, Patrick Flueger, Chad Faust, Conchita Campbell', 'Subtitles': 'English, Portuguese, Spanish', 'Studio': 'Paramount', 'Number of discs': '4'} Review Text: Nice DVD set, your standard box set. No complaints there. USA sucks for cutting the series short though, if you missed the last season and need to play catch up it's worth it, just dont expect a whole lot of much needed closure. Review Title: Great show, Crappy way to end it....or lack of an ending Rating: 4.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: Crank / Crank 2 Review Date: 2011/04/13 Store: Jason Statham (Actor), Amy Smart (Actor), Mark Neveldine (Director), Brian Taylor (Director) & 1 more Rated: NR Format: Blu-ray Categories: Movies & TV, Featured Categories, Blu-ray, Action & Adventure Average Rating: 4.1 Product Details: {'Aspect Ratio': '1.78:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 6.4 Ounces', 'Item model number': '29270', 'Director': 'Mark Neveldine, Brian Taylor', 'Media Format': 'Blu-ray, Multiple Formats, NTSC', 'Release date': 'November 23, 2010', 'Actors': 'Jason Statham, Amy Smart, Efren Ramirez, Jose Pablo Cantillo, Jay Xcala', 'Studio': 'Lions Gate', 'Number of discs': '2'} Review Text: You can't beat this price for two blu ray movies. The fact that it is part 1 & part 2 of crank makes it great. Sometimes you get value packs and it's one movie you want and one movie from 1976 only your dad has watched and he didn't much care for it. I'd say buy this, it's worth it. I'm not going to explain the plot for you, but the movies are good. I just wanted to comment that the value you get is worth the cost and the quality of the packaging and the disks are first rate. Nothing cheap about this disk set, simple yes, but well manufactured. Review Title: Good movie, Even better value pack. Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: Sleeping Beauty (Two-Disc Platinum Edition Blu-ray/DVD Combo + BD Live) [Blu-ray] Review Date: 2012/01/26 Store: Mary Costa (Actor), Eleanor Audley (Actor), Clyde Geronimi (Director) & 0 more Rated: G Format: Blu-ray Categories: Movies & TV, Blu-ray, Movies Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Genre': 'Kids & Family, Special Interests, Action & Adventure', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Multiple Formats', 'Contributor': 'Winston Hibler, Verna Felton, Dal McKennon, Milt Banta, Joe Rinaldi, Marvin Miller, Bill Peet, Clyde Geronimi, Bill Amsbery, Pinto Colvig, Barbara Luddy, Barbara Jo Allen, Mary Costa, Taylor Holmes, Ted Sears, Candy Candido, Charles Perrault, Erdman Penner, Eleanor Audley, Bill Shirley, Bill ThompsonWinston Hibler, Verna Felton, Dal McKennon, Milt Banta, Joe Rinaldi, Marvin Miller, Bill Peet, Clyde Geronimi, Bill Amsbery, Pinto Colvig, Barbara Luddy, Barbara Jo Allen, Mary Costa, Taylor Holmes, Ted Sears, Candy Candido, Charles Perrault, Erdman Penner, Eleanor Audle… See more', 'Language': 'English', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 15 minutes'} Review Text: First of all let me state the truth, I haven't watched this movie in a long time and when I did ( some 20 years ago) I recalled it being dull and flat in it's imagery. Not the same, this remastered bluray is amazing. The colors are striking and its amazing how everything "pops". The story is great too, It's a classic, if you are a boy or a girl it doesn't matter, each can relate. This is a set I would highly recommend, and I would suggest buying it new and joining the Disney Movie rewards program, if you are going to buy the movies you might as well join the free points program, registering your movies gives you free streaming options ( on certain disks) an affordable disc replacement program and a few other minor benefits, its free so might as well. Oi, I sound like I'm being paid to advertise it, I'm not, I'm just a mom and I try to get the best deals possible and share it. Review Title: Excellent, remastered, bright and lovely. Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: Sid the Science Kid: Sid - Sid's Sing Along Review Date: 2012/01/27 Store: Sid (Actor), The Jim Henson Company (Director) Rated: Unrated Format: DVD Categories: Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Kids & Family Product Description: ['Sid the Science Kid is an animated television series using comedy to promote exploration, discovery and science among preschoolers. The characters pose questions and investigate objects and events that can be directly observed and explored.'] Average Rating: 4.7 Product Details: {'Genre': 'Kids & Family', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Animated, Color, NTSC', 'Contributor': 'The Jim Henson Company, Sid', 'Language': 'English', 'Number Of Discs': '1', 'MPAA rating': 'Unrated (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.6 x 5.4 x 7.5 inches; 2.4 Ounces', 'Item model number': '15764317', 'Director': 'The Jim Henson Company', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Animated, Color, NTSC', 'Run time': '1 hour', 'Release date': 'September 15, 2017', 'Actors': 'Sid', 'Studio': 'NCircle Entertainment', 'Number of discs': '1'} Review Text: This is a cute DVD, my kid likes it and I am not annoyed with it in the least. My kid loves music and sing a longs, although you should know there are no follow the bouncing ball sing along here. The sing along, is more like a pageant that the kids throw on a day off school where they sing their favorite songs from school.

The only thing is there seems to be an exceptional amount of trailers or commercials for other cartoons on it. The longest I have ever experienced in any movie. Review Title: It's cute ( a lot of trailers though) Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2012/12/13 Average Rating: 4.7 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'frightening scenes', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Bradley Buecker', 'Alfonso Gomez-Rejon', 'Michael Uppendahl', 'Loni Peristere', 'John J. Gray', 'Jennifer Lynch', 'Gwyneth Horder-Payton', 'Michael Goi', 'Ryan Murphy', 'Michael Lehmann'], 'Starring': ['Lily Rabe', 'Evan Peters', 'Sarah Paulson'], 'Studio': ['FX']} Review Text: Season two of the American Horror story anthology is shaping up to be a "wtf" thrill ride. Well, not an edge of your seat roller coaster ride where you pee your pants or barf in your own face, but more like a nervous passenger in the car while your recently immigrated relative drives on 405 with their new license. You might be thinking, well...that doesn't sound pleasant, but to people like me who like this crap, it is very enjoyable. It is nice for once to not know what the hell is going on in advance, what to expect from the characters, to rely on the same song sung by a different singer over and over and over again in television and movies gets old quick. It's usually always the same damn drivel recycled, and thankfully that is not the case with this show.

Having a show where boy meets girl is not the center of the plot is nice as well. I can't recall a series where there is more than one "bad guy" and added to that developed characters you get sympathy for, save for maybe Dexter. Also a new thing is having different "bad guy" types/categories. For example you'll never see a show with zombies AND Psycho serial killers, especially not with Nazi evil scientists and slutty nuns. I mean call me crazy but even Dexter has drawn it's line of bridges it won't cross. This show doesn't care, it walks in the room and lays it's gigantic balls on the table and say's "See this, I'm doing it, because **** You, that's why"

I liked season one, it was completely different from this one, and that is something I also really like a lot. The anthological nature of the series is pretty cool, because honestly with that much chaos you can't keep it up without the show turning to poo. Also, The opening credits nerps me out, I feel like I am watching old scare tv from the early 90's late 80's, in the dark as a fragile minded preteen. Remember Elvira? Freakshow? Tales from the crypt? We've needed something new that follows those footsteps, the bastard child of the creepshow. Watch a few episodes, you might really like it. Review Title: This show is great. We've needed a good "horror" show on TV for awhile now. Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- Structure your response as: SUMMARY: [Final synthesis of preferences and patterns]
raw_response:
SUMMARY:
The individual demonstrates a clear preference for high-quality entertainment, as evidenced by consistently high ratings (4.5-5.0) across their purchases, indicating a discerning taste. Common themes include a strong inclination towards science fiction, fantasy, action, and family-friendly content, reflecting a diverse palate. They exhibit a particular interest in box sets, suggesting a preference for comprehensive collections that allow for binge-watching and deeper engagement with narratives.

Quality is paramount in their choices, as seen in reviews highlighting excellent manufacturing standards and remastered clarity in visuals. Price sensitivity is notable, as they value cost-effective bundles, such as dual movie packs, suggesting a tendency to seek out deals without compromising on quality.

Additionally, the individual displays an appreciation for unique storytelling, especially favoring narratives that avoid conventional tropes, particularly in horror and drama genres. This showcases an appetite for innovative, genre-bending content. Overall, their core preferences are defined by a blend of quality, family accessibility, and a penchant for intricate storytelling across varied genres, with an emphasis on obtaining good value for their purchases.

target_interaction.title: Really cool concept
target_interaction.text: Im digging it one episode in and I love it. Its pretty intense. having just looked at this and the other reviews im now going to pick up the book. give it a shot, its only an hour to try it out. I hope it continues being as good as the first episode.
